intro: Pilosella lagopus, commonly known as the snowbell, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Pilosella lagopus typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, often on rocky slopes and meadows. Its foliage is covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a distinctive silvery appearance.
